prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples, "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here  "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Merge annotation data and gene expression tables. Plot boxplots for gene expression values per sample and color code boxplots based on group" variable in my annotation data.

response:
```
# Load necessary packages
library(readxl)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)

# Read the count table
count_table <- read_xlsx("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx")

# Read the annotation data
annotation_data <- read.delim("SRP021193.colData.tsv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

# Transpose the count table and remove the first row (gene names)
count_table <- t(count_table)
count_table <- count_table[-1, ]

# Set the row names of count table to be gene names from first column
rownames(count_table) <- count_table[, 1]
count_table <- count_table[, -1]

# Set the row names of annotation data to be sample ids from first column
rownames(annotation_data) <- annotation_data[, 1]
annotation_data <- annotation_data[, -1]

# Merge annotation data and gene expression table based on row names
merged_data <- merge(annotation_data, count_table, by = "row.names")

# Remove the row names column
merged_data <- merged_data[, -1]

# Define the colors for the groups
group_colors <- c("Group1" = "blue", "Group2" = "red", "Group3" = "green")

# Create a boxplot for each sample and color code based on group variable
ggplot(merged_data, aes(x = variable, y = as.numeric(value), fill = group)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  scale_fill_manual(values = group_colors) +
  labs(x = "Sample", y = "Gene Expression Value") +
  theme_minimal()
```
